title: Departure
content:
After having an argument with my parents (no details), the result is simple and short: no internet connection till our economical problems are over. Worse than that, I'll probably have to stay away from the computer for some months (or years).

So I probably won't be here, at least not very active. And my mods will be delayed by this situation. However, as the modding work decreases, the concept art for the mods increases, so when I return, I'll probably be able to quickly finish the mods (Keen 1 mod "lost in the shadows" and keen 4 mod "Back to the Future", temporary name anyway).

With the possibility of accessing internet from the computers at the university, it's more likely that I'll strut around from time to time and speak something, and upload the mods as soon as each one of them are finished. I'll then have to forget about beta-testing, unless there's someone with enough spare time that will always be avaiable for betatesting. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img] But anyway, I'll progress on them when possible, even if I can't get enough feedback. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dexter.gif[/img]

And while I leave you, I say, continue your job, perhaps some day we'll see Keen in the "editor's selection" of a PC games magazine again.

Special thanks in advance to those whose comments have helped a lot in developing my Keen 1 mod: Ceilick, KeenRush, Xky Rauh, Levellass, DaVince, Genius314 and Freeyorp101.

That's all, I leave with a photo of me (taken in November 2006, I wanted to put one for my birthday, Feb 27th but it won't be possible):

[img]http://i144.photobucket.com/albums/r176/shadowm2006/myself.jpg[/img]

Have a happy year 2007.

--- EDIT ---
I'll be back.------------------
SM: "I could go and write a page about the Theory of Relativity (or whatever it's called), but, what is the point if I don't know what the Theory of Relativity is?"

[url=http://shadowm2006.sitesled.com/]My website[/url]

title: Re: Departure
content:
Aww... You're leaving for an undetermined amount of time? That's really too bad... [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-oops.gif[/img]

It was fun having you around, and I hope we'll still see you around often enough.____________
Don't think of me as an ordinary man.

Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]

title: Re: Departure
content:
Too bad.. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img] Hopefully you can stop by once in a while..

Also, can't wait to see those mods. Glad to hear you'll still be working on them.. Chile represents! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-yorp.gif[/img]

And finally, cool pic! Not far off from my mental image. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Departure
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]And finally, cool pic! Not far off from my mental image.[hr][/quote]
Nah, I was in a hurry. I had a nice conversation with Miss X the other day, in which she said I could be a fake, so I just made sure you know I'm real and that I'm alive and kicking (not dead, not running away, and I can ModKeen). [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-mort.gif[/img]

I was out for a week and some people have returned here. Good signal, perhaps this is gonna be a good year for you after all.

Anyways, whenever I get near a Internet connection and a proper computer (we have a computer room in the university running Fedora Core), I'll check the forums.

Perhaps this is the time for someone to gimme an answer to my old question, the answer to the Universe, life and everything...

"WHY in the hell I stumbled upon a Keen 6 v1.0 savegame of level 14 "Bloogbase Management District" in which one of the floating platforms near the end (you know, just above the bridge that you must open) wasn't there, thus making the level impossible to finish without cheats?" I remember that didn't happen if I started a new game and made it there, it was just the saved game. A bug or something? It was very frustrating before I could made it there by the regular way. (NOTE: I didn't know the cheats back then)------------------
SM: "I could go and write a page about the Theory of Relativity (or whatever it's called), but, what is the point if I don't know what the Theory of Relativity is?"

[url=http://shadowm2006.sitesled.com/]My website[/url]

title: hehe
content: I'll keep working, in your absence, imagining you spurring me into action occasionally. (Thank you for your persistance)

title: Goodbye!
content:
Goodbye, I hope you will be able to come back soon!

---Freeyorp

title: Re: Goodbye!
content:
Farewell, fellow monobrow-brother! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] ----------
www.StrifeStrips.com! Woot! We're back, baby!

title: Re: Goodbye!
content:
Damn, man! I just got Visual C++ yesterday, and I look to see if you are online, and now I know you're not going to be online for a long time. DAMNIT!

Anyways, good luck with whatevers up man, hope you come back soon. Very soon.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I've changed a lot since my last time on this forum...
